candidates.title: Rustls 0.20 and HttpsConnectorBuilder
candidates.body:
This upgrades rustls to 0.20 (pending a release of rustls-native-certs), and ports the HttpsConnectorBuilder in #145 to something more like rustls' new [ConfigBuilder](https://docs.rs/rustls/0.20.0/rustls/struct.ConfigBuilder.html) (typestate based).

Parts of the rustls 0.20 work were taken from #153.

candidates.title: fix: Only report http2 support if the http2 feature is enabled
Remove futures-util
candidates.body: `h2`, `hyper` and `reqwest` import `futures-util` with no default features, to make it faster to compile. This crate doesn't actually need it, so I moved it to dev-dependencies where an example uses it.

candidates.title: Upgrade to tokio 1.0 - hyper 0.14
candidates.body:
Also tries to reduce the features enabled for `hyper`

~~EDIT: I forgot to make this into a draft PR. Anyway, let's wait for tokio-rustls to be released, at the moment we are importing it from git.~~

candidates.title: Force backend choice through API rather than features
candidates.body: Unlike the suggestion in #125, this only enables the native-tokio feature by default, but it enables all features in docs.rs, annotating both of the `HttpsConnector` constructors with the required feature flags (the required feature is only available in nightly for now, but docs.rs always runs nightly rustdoc). I believe this is better since it doesn't unnecessarily bloat the dependency graph of downstream crates, but I'm happy to change it if you feel strongly about enabling both.

candidates.title: build(deps): update tokio requirement from 0.2.4 to 0.3.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v0.3.4

Fixed

  • stream: StreamMap Default impl bound (#3093).
  • io: AsyncFd::into_inner() should deregister the FD (#3104).

Changed

  • meta: parking_lot feature enabled with full (#3119).

Added

  • io: AsyncWrite vectored writes (#3149).
  • net: TCP/UDP readiness and non-blocking ops (#3130, #2743, #3138).
  • net: TCP socket option (linger, send/recv buf size) (#3145, #3143).
  • net: PID field in UCred with solaris/illumos (#3085).
  • rt: runtime::Handle allows spawning onto a runtime (#3079).
  • sync: Notify::notify_waiters() (#3098).
  • sync: acquire_many(), try_acquire_many() to Semaphore (#3067).
Commits
  • 479c545 chore: prepare v0.3.4 release (#3152)
  • 34fcef2 io: add vectored writes to AsyncWrite (#3149)
  • 7d11aa8 net: add SO_LINGER get/set to TcpStream (#3143)
  • 0ea2307 net: add UdpSocket readiness and non-blocking ops (#3138)
  • d0ebb41 sync: add Notify::notify_waiters (#3098)
  • f5cb4c2 net: Add send/recv buf size methods to TcpSocket (#3145)
  • 4e39c9b net: restore TcpStream::{poll_read_ready, poll_write_ready} (#2743)
  • 97c2c42 chore: automate running benchmarks (#3140)
  • 60366ca chore: update pin-project-lite to 0.2.0 (#3139)
  • 850bfc9 net: add missing doc cfg on TcpSocket (#3137)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: build(deps): update bytes requirement from 0.5 to 0.6

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [bytes](https://github.com/tokio-rs/bytes) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from bytes's releases.

v0.6.0

API polish in preparation for a 1.0 release.

Changed

  • BufMut is now an unsafe trait (#432).
  • BufMut::bytes_mut() returns &mut UninitSlice, a type owned by bytes to avoid undefined behavior (#433).
  • Buf::copy_to_bytes(len) replaces Buf::into_bytes() (#439).
  • Buf/BufMut utility methods are moved onto the trait and *Ext traits are removed (#431).

Removed

  • BufMut::bytes_vectored_mut() (#430).
  • new methods on combinator types (#434).
Changelog

Sourced from bytes's changelog.

0.6.0 (October 21, 2020)

API polish in preparation for a 1.0 release.

Changed

  • BufMut is now an unsafe trait (#432).
  • BufMut::bytes_mut() returns &mut UninitSlice, a type owned by bytes to avoid undefined behavior (#433).
  • Buf::copy_to_bytes(len) replaces Buf::into_bytes() (#439).
  • Buf/BufMut utility methods are moved onto the trait and *Ext traits are removed (#431).

Removed

  • BufMut::bytes_vectored_mut() (#430).
  • new methods on combinator types (#434).

0.5.6 (July 13, 2020)

  • Improve BytesMut to reuse buffer when fully advanced.
  • Mark BytesMut::{as_mut, set_len} with #[inline].
  • Relax synchronization when cloning in shared vtable of Bytes.
  • Move loom to dev-dependencies.

0.5.5 (June 18, 2020)

Added

  • Allow using the serde feature in no_std environments (#385).

Fix

  • Fix BufMut::advance_mut to panic if advanced passed the capacity (#354)..
  • Fix BytesMut::freeze ignoring amount previously advanced (#352).

0.5.4 (January 23, 2020)

Added

  • Make Bytes::new a const fn.
  • Add From<BytesMut> for Bytes.

Fix

  • Fix reversed arguments in PartialOrd for Bytes.
  • Fix Bytes::truncate losing original capacity when repr is an unshared Vec.
  • Fix Bytes::from(Vec) when allocator gave Vec a pointer with LSB set.
  • Fix panic in Bytes::slice_ref if argument is an empty slice.

0.5.3 (December 12, 2019)

Added

  • must_use attributes to split, split_off, and split_to methods (#337).

Fix

Commits
  • b7f7582 prepare v0.6.0 release (#440)
  • 39de065 Add Buf::copy_to_bytes(len) (#439)
  • 5866839 use checked addition with range (#438)
  • e0d8413 Switch BufMut::bytes_mut to&mut UninitSlice (#433)
  • 5a11c78 De-emphasize Arc implementation in Bytes description (#436)
  • 4724c7e remove new fns from combinator structs (#434)
  • ced0507 Make BufMut an unsafe trait (#432)
  • 94c543f remove ext traits (#431)
  • 447530b Remove BufMut::bytes_vectored_mut() (#430)
  • 422048e prepare for 0.6 work (#428)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Update to allow use of webpki-roots where rustls-native-certs fails.
candidates.body:
This adds the option to use webpki-roots in the cases where rustls-native-certs fails or is impossible, for example `aarch64-linux-android` (<https://github.com/ctz/rustls-native-certs/issues/3> is not possible, as the keystore is unavailable as per <https://developer.android.com/training/articles/keystore>), `aarch64-unknown-none` (it literally doesn't exist), microcontroller classes, `x86_64-unknown-cloudabi`/`aarch64-unknown-cloudabi` (also doesn't exist), `wasm32-wasi` (needs embedded or local thing), etc.

~~This additionally adds a compile time check for handling root store without required feature.~~

candidates.title: don't depend on hyper/tcp feature by default
candidates.body:
On fuchsia, we don't support the mio and tokio runtime yet, and so in order to use hyper-rustls, we need to compile it with `default-features = false`. Unfortunately, in https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/pull/96, @CryZe added a hard requirement for the hyper "tcp" feature, which pulls in the tokio runtime.

To restore our ability to use hyper-rustls, this patch migrates the "hyper/tcp" hard feature requirement to an optional "tcp" feature. Note that we don't need to change the default case, because the "hyper/runtime" feature already depends on "hyper/tcp".

candidates.title: Implement Support for Hyper 0.13.0
candidates.body:
This implements support for Hyper 0.13.0.

Fixes #93
Resolves #92

chosen_pr.title: Rustls 0.20 and HttpsConnectorBuilder
chosen_pr.body:
This upgrades rustls to 0.20 (pending a release of rustls-native-certs), and ports the HttpsConnectorBuilder in #145 to something more like rustls' new [ConfigBuilder](https://docs.rs/rustls/0.20.0/rustls/struct.ConfigBuilder.html) (typestate based).

Parts of the rustls 0.20 work were taken from #153.

chosen_detail.title: Rustls 0.20 and HttpsConnectorBuilder
chosen_detail.body:
This upgrades rustls to 0.20 (pending a release of rustls-native-certs), and ports the HttpsConnectorBuilder in #145 to something more like rustls' new [ConfigBuilder](https://docs.rs/rustls/0.20.0/rustls/struct.ConfigBuilder.html) (typestate based).

Parts of the rustls 0.20 work were taken from #153.
